name: Hotel Saratoga

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check-in started off well with a friendly, helpful man but unfortunately took three attempts before getting a room which wasn't already occupied! Our room seemed larger than average although was not a refurbished one it was clean with a nice balcony and a very comfortable bed. Lots of amenities like shaving and tooth brushing kits so good if you are travelling with just hand luggage. Hairdryer was a bog standard hotel one which wasn't great but did work. The pools looked nice but the weather wasn't good enough for me to use them. The jazz bar was very good. There is a live band Thursday to Saturday and during the day, the views across the marina are lovely. Breakfast was plentiful and went on until 10.30am which was welcome. All in all I would return and recommend.
reviews.title: Overall good experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Saratoga is ideally placed in the city centre for shops and restaurants or walking to Portitxol and harbour. A couple of tips, don't hire a car if you are staying at the Saratoga as parking is on a restricted one way street with metres which are constantly monitored, it's probably not ideal for families but great for couples with a super roof top pool/gym/bar with views of the cathedral and the cruise ships coming and going. We had an excellent west facing room on the sixth floor with a small balcony and first rate walk in wet room type shower.
reviews.title: Enjoy the City

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012

Staff very helpful.
reviews.title: Very nice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The hotel location is excellent for a trip to Palma. We stayed for a couple of nights on a Ryanair midweek quickie. From the hotel entrance you can turn left and head down to the harbour front and along to the modern part with the larger hotels, bars and restaurants, or turn right and down into the old town with its wonderful buildings, bars, restaurants and shops. There are also many bars and restaurants around the hotel its self.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, great value for money, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would say that the hotel is more business orientated and not really for holiday makers especially with young children. There are two pools one in the courtyard at the rear and a smaller one on the roof above the bar. I never saw anyone in the courtyard (except the builders). The views from the roof top pool and sun terrace, like the hotel bar, are superb, with a 360 degree view, however unless you are lucky enough to get a room on the front over looking the river then you won’t have much of a view from your balcony. We, like 80% of the rooms, could look down on the pool and across at an eight storey blank wall.
reviews.title: Palma Centre Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have just recently returned from this hotel (stayed there first week in May 08). First impressions were good, until the young male receptionist decided to give us a room with no balcony overlooking the entrance to the underground car park on the ground floor. Having already requested a room with a balcony, after seeing our room we complained. A female receptionist, after a lot of persuasion and complaining from us and having to show them our original booking a number of times, eventually gave us a room over looking the marina at the front of the hotel. This room was nice and big with a balcony. But it was a little grubby with dirty floors (covered in dust) and the shower fittings were coming away from the wall, not particularly worthy of its 4 stars - especially as the room rates are not cheap! There is not much storage space for your clothes/luggage despite the big room! However, the hotel is ideally located for everything in Palma, walking distance to the marina, restaurants, cathedral (great view of the cathedral from the bar/pool on the top floor of the hotel) and if you have a room at the front of the hotel - a great view of the castle on the hill too. The hotel does have parking, but it is charged at €10 per night (still cheaper than other car parks). Breakfasts are good, but staff are very sour faced. Tea/coffee is not fresh but from self-service machines. There is a good choice of cheese, meats, cereals and fruit and delicious pastries. It also has internet access in the foyer/lobby - but be quick - there is only 1 PC and often a lengthy wait to get on. Don't be surprised if you return back to your room for a shower and there are no towels - this happened to us a few times and when we requested towels the staff are not particularly quick and bringing them up to your room either! This hotel is pleasant enough , but it really wouldn't hurt the staff to be more helpful and better mannered.
reviews.title: 4 Star? Could have fooled me!

likes.disliked: — Sour faced staff who don't smile.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Saratoga is ideally placed for seeing the main sites in Palma. It is a 20 minute taxi ride from the airport and located in a quiet side road. A 5 minute walk to the sea front, 15 minutes to the Cathederal and 25 minutes to the train station, for the train ride to Soller. Just around the corner is Avinguda Jaume III, the road with all the best shops. All the pedestrianised areas with the tourist sites are within easy reach.
reviews.title: Good central location
Good location for shopping .
reviews.text: The hotel is modern, exceptionally clean and we found the reception staff very efficient and friendly. It appears to have a lot of businnes people staying as well as tourists. Our room was large, well decorated, excellent bathroom/shower and overlooked the pool area. While this made the location quiet, the one downside was that the room walls were very thin. With considerate guests this was not a problem but TV noise, noisy guests and the dreaded stilletos on uncarpeted floors were obtrusive. There is a pool on the ground floor and a smaller pool on the roof, next to a great bar with views over the sea and city

reviews.title: Great Location! Room not 4 star
reviews.text: A great start to the day was the breakfast buffet, an enormous selection of good quality foods. There is no point in listing it, everything was there. Forget lunch, this will last you through to early evening tapas.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I stayed here with some freinds to experiance a weekend in Palma enjoying the sites, tapas & wine. We stayed in a junior suite and the room had a safe, mini bar and a large bathroom. It didnt have a balcony as it was located to the front of the hotel. The bar was great and we enjoyed jazz on the friday and blues on the saturday night and you had a great view of the city. The rooftop pool was a little crowded so we decided to sun bathe to the rear of the hotel. It was nice and quiet but it wasnt the most attractive area to be in. I didnt eat there so I cant make any comments about the food. The staff were pleasant but it could do with a larger reception area as we had to wait a bit to check in and it was a little crrowded. I would stay there again as the location is great and if the weather isnt very good you have other facilities to use like the indoor pool, spa and bar.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent a week at the Saratoga at the beginning of October. It is very well placed on the edge of the old town and just a short walk through a park past the Museum of Modern Art to reach the sea.Round the corner is one of the main shopping streets. The hotel is not really suitable for guests with mobility problems as the lift stops on the floor above the dining room and then you have to walk down some stairs. There are stunning views of the cathedral and marina from the roof-top pool area. Jazz bar on the 6th floor has live music Thursday Friday and Saturday. This area is very nicely furnshed. Snacks here are good although service is a bit slow.

reviews.title: BEWARE OF FAKE ADD ON CREDIT CARD CHARGES!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: I stayed at Hotel Saratoga mainly because of the location during a business trip and they added on 57 euros in mini bar charges after I departed. The problem is that there was NO mini bar presented during check-in or available anywhere in the room. The front desk clerk cheerfully arranged a taxi at 0500 to the airport to fly out of country and then added on the charges to my account after I checked out. After three months of fighting, No chance of winning this type of dispute with the credit card because they faked a handwritten "minibar" bill and will continuously insist the charge is valid. I know a little Spanish and made the honest attempt to converse, but try questioning a charge and they will conveniently forget their English. 57 euros is 57 euros, not a truly devastating loss, but they're still thieves. Think twice while traveling in Mediterranean countries on the brink of economic collapse because they know you will not win in the credit card dispute and you will be long gone before you notice the charges on your statement.
reviews.title: Great for enjoying the best of Palma

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked this hotel at short notice when visiting my brother in hospital. I wanted a central hotel with comfort and good business facilities. This was perfect, close to shops, transports, sights, harbour. Excellent service from desk staff, good room with free wifi everywhere for £81 per night. Jazz bar was a real treat, good food and drink and excellent musicians on 3 of my 5 nights there. Nice pool, gym and spa, but too much to do and see in Palma to need these.
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Returning next week and will stay here again, very convenient and safe for a woman travelling alone.
reviews.title: Average hotel in a good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I have just stayed at the Hotel Saratoga for one night. This is the third time we have stayed at this hotel as the location is just perfect for shopping and city sightseeing. We stayed on the first floor and did not smell the drains as has been written about previously. We had a junior suite with a balcony overlooking the courtyard . It was extremely clean as it always is when we visit. We always use this elegant hotel when visiting Palma. The Jazz club is perfect for an evenings entertainment but the food there is not the best. We would have a meal in Palma previously to finishing with a drink at the club. There is a good breakfast buffet.
reviews.title: city break

description: The Hotel Saratoga, in Palma (Majorca) was established in 1962 and has been recently refurbished. The Hotel Saratoga is situated in a central but quiet location in Palma (Majorca), near one of the most popular and prestigious commercial avenues of the city - Avenue Jaime III - close to the Paseo Maritimo promenade, the Cathedral and the Harbour. Built in a conventional style, the Hotel Saratoga has a fresh and comfortable atmosphere, a sober decor, and excellent facilities, equipment and service. The Hotel Saratoga disposes 187 luxury rooms and offers free wireless high speed internet throughout the whole hotel. There is a BLUE JAZZ CLUB with live Jazz Music and the presence of the best Jazz artists in Majorca. The Hotel Saratoga is highly recommended for Conventions and Business, tourism, Golf and leisure guests.
